channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Colleges are fleeing from The PhD Project, which helps Black and Latino students get business degrees, as it’s attacked by Trump anti-DEI activists
item.description: The U.S. Education Department last week said it was investigating dozens of universities for alleged racial discrimination, citing ties to the nonprof...

item.title: The Size of the Tax Cut
item.description: We explain how Republicans are approaching taxes.

item.title: A China War Briefing for Musk, and London’s Heathrow Shuts Down
item.description: Plus, one of the most problem-plagued movies in Disney history.

item.title: Germany, ‘Orphaned’ by U.S., Shakes Off the Shock and Stirs to Action
item.description: No country in Europe is as much a product of enlightened postwar American diplomacy. Now adrift, it has begun to reckon with a new world.

item.title: The return-to-office battle is jeopardizing the new American Dream: staying at home
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic did spur more Americans to stay home, but also accelerated ongoing trends.

item.title: A bubble tea chain and a toy doll are the latest casualties of Beijing and Hanoi’s competing claims over the South China Sea
item.description: Vietnamese flooded Chagee with negative comments after the bubble tea chain's app used a map that endorsed Beijing's expansive territorial claims.

item.title: Heathrow Airport Closure Wreaks Havoc on Travelers Worldwide
item.description: Flights for thousands of passengers were disrupted by the shutdown on Friday at London Heathrow, one of the world’s busiest airports.

item.title: Elaine Chao on the Trump Administration: ‘What you all want is certainty and you’re not going to get it’
item.description: Also: Tesla bulls turn on Elon, Europe’s busiest airport was closed by a huge fire.

item.title: Trump gives New York 30 more days to end Manhattan congestion toll as state officials refuse to comply
item.description: The Trump administration has pushed back a Friday deadline for New York to end its new $9 congestion toll on most drivers entering Manhattan.

item.title: What We Know About the Closure of Heathrow Airport
item.description: A fire at a substation in London cut off power to one of the world’s busiest airports, causing travel disruptions globally.

item.title: Germany, ‘Orphaned’ by U.S., Shakes Off the Shock and Stirs to Action
item.description: No country in Europe is as much a product of enlightened postwar American diplomacy. Now adrift, it has begun to reckon with a new world.

item.title: Live Updates: Fire Halts Operations at London’s Heathrow Airport, Throwing Global Travel Into Disarray
item.description: A giant blaze near one of the world’s busiest airports knocked out power, Britain’s energy minister said, and the cause was under investigation. Tens ...

item.title: What Happens When a Hub Like Heathrow Shuts Down
item.description: Lots of people need to secure hotel rooms and new travel plans.

item.title: What We Know About the Closure of Heathrow Airport
item.description: A fire at a substation in London cut off power to one of the world’s busiest airports, causing travel disruptions globally.

item.title: Sudan’s Army Retakes the Presidential Palace in Khartoum
item.description: Two years into a civil war, troops recaptured the palace in Khartoum, routing a paramilitary foe. Civilians have been trapped in the middle in a city ...
